Dialog.text: Whoever you are, run. There is no more food here except you.
Dialog.notes: Sighs, this is said as defeat, not a warning. Worried. Doesn't know if the appraoching person is a person or controlled by the aliens.

Dialog.text: You found something?
Hnh... what is this?
I open the door, I'll let you in.
You are safe now, the beasts... they cannot get in.
I cannot pry open freezer vents. Tried already, locked tight. Try if you do not believe me.
We have food, but it will not last long, I think.
I know who you are, M. Yu...
Son of William Yu. William. TranStar... always playing with lives.
Your father, he put so many of us in prison, then in this prison.
Running out of bodies, wasting food. Seen you once, you cannot step in again.
Dialog.notes: Slight taunt, rocking to himself, singing slightly (he's talking about the telepath)

Dialog.text: Where did 84 go, I wonder.
Stop making those. There is no "Quinten" here.
Hnh. One prison cell for another.
(Eating Noises)
Stupid piece of American chunk.
Dialog.notes: Luka confuses "chunk" for "junk"

Dialog.text: If you are still ahold of your brain, good. Others here? Are not. Shoot first before they get close - they are puppets. Bombs.
You still here? Still you?
Only safe place is in kitchen. If you are human, I will let you in, then the two of us figure out what to do next.
No eggs behind your eyes, no black swimming. Others come... try to act human, get me to open the door.
(Negative Grunt) Safe in here.
When puppets can't get in, explode like bombs. The beast lays eggs in their head, make them explode.
Maybe you're one, too... hunh? Come to dig me out.
Dialog.notes: {Frown, calculating}

Dialog.text: Your suit - what is on your nametag - "Yu"? "M. Yu"?
Dialog.notes: Ruminating on the name. It sounds familiar.

Dialog.text: M. Yu, maybe you are like me, maybe not - but you want to come in, be safe? Bring me something human, something a human can understand. This key... it opens bunk.
Dialog.notes: Luka drops key into service tray

Dialog.text: Now go.
Hnh. No. Something else, I think.
What crosses your mind with this?
I have no use for this.
No. Think harder.
Bring me nothing, you get nothing.
What crosses your mind with this? Too alien, I think.
Dialog.notes: Player dropped an alien organ in the tray

Dialog.text: Come inside. Quick now.
Taste like eel... and something else.
Dialog.notes: Wrinkles in disgust.

Dialog.text: If hungry, eat, but I warn you.
I already hear this name before... where...
Dialog.notes: Muttering to himself.

Dialog.text: But... look at this...
Dialog.notes: Luka points or walks player toward water closet / sink.

Dialog.text: Did you check Greenhouse?
Who are you?
We have food. But no water. This... pressure regulator... it is broken. System automatic cut off until fixed.
You can find a replacement part in Greenhouse, I think. With water, we can wait for rescue. No water... (Negative Grunt)
Do this favor, I let you into freezer.
That's where I hid all the puppets the beast send first. Maybe they have useful things for you, no?
You fix? Hmmph. Smart one...
Dialog.notes: Luka did not expect this and should sound dissapointed.

Dialog.text: Here. Key to freezer, like I promised. Lots of dead puppets and supplies.
Dialog.notes: Sharp. A little upset because things are moving too fast for him. (alt in case it's a lock/key)

Dialog.text: No water. Need to find another regulator.

Dialog.notes: Like a hmph. Judging.

Dialog.text: Are you frightened of the puppets?
M. Yu... how do you have this already? You are thinking in front of time?
Dialog.notes: Unnerved. Suspicious.

Dialog.text: (Grunt) What kind of brain?
Dialog.notes: Grumbling to self.

Dialog.text: Good. Now we safe until rescue comes. Take some food. Drink water.
If you hungry... eat.
Go in. Take whatever you want. Only leave puppets for me.
Ehn.. M. Yu... M. Yu... Hmm.
Dialog.notes: To self.. thinking. Why does his name sound familiar.
Thoughtful. Considering something.

Dialog.text: You don't like the taste?
Dialog.notes: to self. ends in a bitter chuckle

Dialog.text: Can't let them close...
Dialog.notes: Muttering to self.

Dialog.text: ...is not black eggs.
Dialog.notes: Muttering to self.

Dialog.text: Keep it closed. We do not need to keep twisting our luck.
Close door. It is all that is between us and beasts.

Dialog.notes: Derisive. Almost a laugh.

Dialog.text: Now speaking piece of chunk is silent piece of chunk.
TranStar trashcan. Not even worth the parts.

Dialog.notes: Satisfied chuckle 2-3 seconds.

Dialog.text: Quiet now.

Dialog.notes: Mocking, to destroyed Operator.

Dialog.text: TranStar trashcan. Not even worth the parts.
You are said to be the smart one. You have a way off station?
Now... maybe I watch these beasts eat you. Like you tried to feed me to them.
Or... cold kills you first. Make you into a frozen puppet.
Dialog.notes: End on a chuckle.

Dialog.text: Daughter of William Yu. William. TranStar... always playing with lives.
TranStar piece of chunk... Are you awake, M. Yu? Frozen dead maybe?
Dialog.notes: Luka is trying to get Chloe's TS.

Dialog.text: I take puppet's toy screen. I see all the names in a list. Your name too.
Means you listen from now on.
...you go, where you go... M. Yu. Maybe... this setting.
Dialog.notes: Starts with some muttering, static.

Dialog.text: Stupid chunk. Ah, wait, wait. Are you in station vault? Make it hard to find you.
You will not like what is inside. Maybe you feel it in your head, like I do? Like birthing pain, maybe.
The beasts, I think they make a child just to kill you.
You ripped open an eye in my brain. I see a horizon, filled with teeth. It is coming closer. Maybe it is what you see?
I am hungry. I am always hungry.
Dialog.notes: Confused, distant.

Dialog.text: I will wait, M. Yu. You will come out. Nowhere to go.
Dialog.notes: Cold. Back to Morgan.

Dialog.text: Nowhere to go.
Dialog.notes: Soft. Sinister, pulling away from TS.

Dialog.text: M. Yu. I find you outside your prison. Maybe trying to escape. Like me.
Dialog.notes: Chiding. Taunting.

Dialog.text: Not safe out there. But you know this.
You have headaches? See things?
It is not fever, not hallucinations. A horizon is coming, cutting through space. If we are still here when it arrives...
Dialog.notes: Warning. Clicks his tongue at the end.

Dialog.text: It screams so loud, we hear it in our head. It is still far away, but it is coming closer. It will eat your prison, every person on board. And it will still be hungry. Where will it go next, I wonder?
I see you back in your prison soon, M. Yu.
You came back in from outside. Fixed elevators. Thank you, now I can move free.
You - not so much.
You are... in Life Support. A joke there, I think.
Dialog.notes: Checking, says Life Support slowly, like trying to get his head around each word

Dialog.text: Eel tanks. Where your TranStar food comes from, chopped up and made new colors. Connected to septic system. A joke there too, I think.
M. Yu? You are still alive? Good.
We learn to make mines in Ukraine from recycling TranStar chunk, wanted to share knowledge with you.
Dialog.notes: Slightly proud, but cold - enjoying the poetic justice

Dialog.text: TranStar chunk not go off. M. Yu... maybe you see it, avoid it?
Dialog.notes: Slightly concerned. Thinking.

Dialog.text: The Yu family cause much trouble on Earth. Now they play with the stars and expect not to burn.
I wondered why you opened us to the chamber, make us see a horizon. Sharp, razored... hungry.
You surround yourself with machines, with things. They cannot keep you safe. They will eat you as well.
After they eat you, maybe I take your suit, become M. Yu, get shuttle access?
These headaches, they are getting worse. Like teeth in the brain, sinking in.
Dialog.notes: Wincing a little.

Dialog.text: You feel it, M. Yu?
Screaming is louder now, getting close. I think screams are coming from the future, M. Yu. Screams of people on Earth. Screams an animal makes when caught in a hunter's jaw.
Dialog.notes: Worried, then becomes slightly distant

Dialog.text: This is for M.Yu. So you don't forget.
TranStar asks for volunteers for experiment in space. Promises to let us go from prison if we come to this one - a life sentence, over in a day.
Like all TranStar deals... is false.
They take us up in shuttle, like cattle. Take us to your prison, feed us, run tests.
But something is wrong, I think. They put us back on shuttle, say the tests are over, we are free. They drug us, herd us like cattle...
...and then they bring us back here. You bring us back here. And kill us one by one, feed us to your beasts while you watch and take notes.
I see it. There - "M. Yu," on your uniform. You watch as you open my cage, let me see the beast you keep here.
It is not evil, I think. It is an animal. It is hungry, but the hunger... it is everywhere, it is hungry for thought.
It enters my brain, leaves hunger there, like an egg, it grows, cracks. Its hunger is inside me... it is almost all I can think about.
But it does not eat me, maybe it does not like how I think. Or sees my brain is wrong. Or maybe you decide to stop when I scream?
I go back to my cell, and doctors comes with needles and tests and questions. I bite their fingers, swallow them whole - and they beat me, take me to security.

Alarms... guards try and move me... and I kill them. But their uniforms do not fit, I am still hungry. Go find crew to blend in. Find the kitchen, find an idiot man who lets me in, and I look at him - his suit is my size. I kill him, and now I am him.
I do this again, and again, help people come to kitchen, see what they have, kill them. They are just TranStar.
Go back to your master, puppets. Tell it that you will have to go hungry today.
I can see what's behind your eyes. You can't fool me.
There is no food here for you, puppets! Leave me be.
Morgan Yu. This pod will work, but I do not know how to launch it.
Dialog.notes: Luka is badly injured and laboring to speak. He is dying.

Dialog.text: Let's resolve our conflict on Earth. In the fresh air. With worms under our feet.
Dialog.notes: Luka is badly injured and laboring to speak. He is dying.

Dialog.text: Join me. I saved you a seat.
Dialog.notes: Luka is badly injured and laboring to speak. He is dying.

Dialog.text: I will die soon. No need to fear me now.
We are over now. Hahahahaha...
Dialog.notes: Weak and dying, but summons up just enough energy to be triumphant. He is serving justice with his death. The laugh will trail into the explosion.
Grumbling over the PA mic.

Dialog.text: I see you. Another puppet.
Dialog.notes: Player should mistake Luka as addressing him, but actually talking to the MC humans.

Dialog.text: Looking for me with black eggs behind your eyes. Come closer.
Dialog.notes: Almost angry.

Dialog.text: Yes... a little closer-
Dialog.notes: (explosive blast) cuts of Luka - Trying to taunt a mc human into attacking.

Dialog.text: (Grim Chuckle)
Dialog.notes: Luka chuckling to himself. Stupid puppets.

Dialog.text: Stupid puppets. What? You too? You want to come into kitchen? Good, come!
Dialog.notes: Trolling the mc humans.

Dialog.text: How many? How many bodies do you have, eh?
Dialog.notes: A little anger at the end.

Dialog.text: Keep sending and sending...
Dialog.notes: Angry muttering under his breath.

Dialog.text: When will you stop? Stop!
Dialog.notes: ramp up to an agnry shout.

Dialog.text: ...can't think with all the puppet bombs.
Dialog.notes: back to under his breath

Dialog.text: Nnh... why do you obey? You can't fight the beast voice?
Dialog.notes: Almost taunting the mc humans for being weak-minded.

Dialog.text: When no more puppets... maybe we talk.
What is this?
Dialog.notes: suspicious murmur

Dialog.text: Eh... something.
Dialog.notes: suspicious murmur

Dialog.text: Shhh. More beasts coming...
Dialog.notes: Danger. Get ready.

Dialog.text: No. No. Nothing.
Dialog.notes: Disregard. More like grunts.

Dialog.text: It's gone. I did not imagine it.
Dialog.notes: I'm not crazy.

Dialog.text: Bah. It will come back later.
You should stop that. They will come for you.
That is... (Grunt)
Dialog.notes: Keeping my thoughts to myself.

Dialog.text: Hmmn. Your brain is like a beast.
You make joke?
Now you have woken something terrrible.

Dialog.notes: Chuckling to himself. A bit manic.

Dialog.text: No, no. I won't fight.
Peace! Don't harm me.

Dialog.notes: Surprised. A little angry?

Dialog.text: Please. I'm not a threat to you.
You tricked me?
Dialog.notes: Surprised. A little angry?

Dialog.text: Almost. Only a few puppets left.
Good. Come to kitchen window. We will talk.
Go around. The side entrance.

Dialog.notes: A little projected... player's on the other side of the door.

Dialog.text: A minute...
Dialog.notes: A little projected... player's on the other side of the door.
short exhertion, like gritted teeth, pulling hard on a rusty bolt or swinging a hammer one time.

Dialog.text: Here. I open freezer now, like I promised. Lots of dead puppets and supplies.
Dialog.notes: Alt, in case it's a keypad instead of a lock.

Dialog.text: You can find a replacement part in the Fitness Center. The pool, I think. With water, we can wait for rescue. No water... (Negative Grunt)
Dialog.notes: Alt in case we move the quest to the pool area.

Dialog.text: Your cowardice will haunt you for the reminder of your days. But my death is easy. No more nightmares...
Dialog.notes: Luka passes out at the end of this line. He is fading.

Dialog.text: Who's there?!
Dialog.notes: Someone's rattling at his front door, accusing.

Dialog.text: You can't get in here!
Can't get in heerrre.
Dialog.notes: Sing-song, taunt.

Dialog.text: Only get in if I let you in.
Dialog.notes: Emphasis on "I."

Dialog.text: Regulator first.
Open freezer when have new regulator.
You are one of them!
Stupid beast! You think you can kill me with them?
Dialog.notes: Taunting, emphasis on THEM, like they're worthless (he's referring to TranStar employees).

Dialog.text: Can't get me, can you.
Dialog.notes: Cold, speaking to Telepath. Emphasis on CAN.

Dialog.text: You run out of puppets, maybe you starve.
Their master is close. Kill beast, or puppets, or both - but do it before they kill you.
Their master... it is running out of bodies.

Dialog.notes: Viciously gleeful (player killed an evil telepath)

Dialog.text: Your puppets all dead - now you join them!
Dialog.notes: Emphasis on JOIN.

Dialog.text: You... come to kitchen window. Let me see you.
Dialog.notes: Talking to player, curious, beckoning (thinks player might be good victim).

Dialog.text: Kill a few of your puppets, now you join them.
Dialog.notes: Emphasis on JOIN.

Dialog.text: Couldn't hide behind your puppets - hnh. Kill you, saves them?
Dialog.notes: Gets quieter, to himself, asking as if he wouldn't have made that choice (shrugging it off).

Dialog.text: M. Yu. You kill beast yourself? Hnh. If you want to come in, be safe... you go... get something of mine, hnh?
Dialog.notes: Suspicious, knows who Morgan Yu is, wants to kill him - 2nd half after ellipses is "thinking" as if thinking of a way to kill Morgan.

Dialog.text: Here - key... it opens my room.
Go there, get my... award. It's important to me.
Dialog.notes: A little eviler, the award isn't important, it's a trap.

Dialog.text: Then... Maybe we talk.
Dialog.notes: "I'll never see you again."

Dialog.text: Don't worry about power, flickering... station is just hurting. Keep going.
Dialog.notes: Pushing player to go on. Emphasis on "hurting."

Dialog.text: You still there, M. Yu? You still alive? Hnh.
Dialog.notes: Player finds item. Luka isn't sure, but prompting to see if player alive, hoping player is dead.

Dialog.text: Hnh. What if M. Yu comes back... let M. Yu in? But...
Dialog.notes: Mumbles to himself, a little worried, doesn't realize he might be heard.

Dialog.text: You find it? You back?
Dialog.notes: More surprise, worry.

Dialog.text: Come to window. Show me.
Dialog.notes: Angry, accusing.

Dialog.text: Hnh. Have to let you in, promised.
Dialog.notes: Realization, not happy, says this to himself, as if trying to convince himself to do something he doesn't want to do.

Dialog.text: Replacement part in Greenhouse, but... hnh.
Dialog.notes: Shrugs at end.

Dialog.text: Hnh. Freezer... it is where I hid puppets beast send first.
Dialog.notes: Worried. Trying to make up a story as to why there are bodies in the fridge.

Dialog.text: Maybe they have useful things for you? Or maybe inside is another way out?
